stadium.name: The Hollow Mine
stadium.description: The playing field is the circular, wildflower-covered clearing at the base of the imposing, ivy-covered Watch Tower. The ground hums with a strange energy, and the home team makes their entrance from the newly-opened mine shaft that bores deep into the tower's foundation.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing how many dried beans they can fit in their nostril.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Giving a rambling, often nonsensical 'pump-up' speech.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Insisting on wearing a ridiculously oversized, floppy hat during warm-ups.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Braiding a teammate's nose hair.

stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.

preGame:
Greetings, ghouls, ghosts, and glorious gladiators of Osterra! Your favorite demon of the airwaves, Nok the Corrupter, is coming to you live from the delightfully dark and damp Hollow Mine! It‚Äôs the playoffs, folks! Can you feel that electricity? It‚Äôs not just the humming earth beneath our feet; it's the smell of desperation and the sweet, sweet promise of a Best-of-3 series! We‚Äôve got a real dilly of a match today as the Wyrmwood Stronghammers look to defend their turf against those flashy interlopers, the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres! üèüÔ∏è‚ú®

Now, look at those Stronghammers down on the field! Sabian Gleason is staring at the ceiling, trying to count clouds‚Äîa bold strategy considering we're at the base of a tower, but hey, that's playoff focus for you! Meanwhile, Ultun Barthelemy is busy braiding a teammate's nose hair. Now that's the kind of intimate teamwork that warms my cold, corrupted heart! They‚Äôve got the home-field advantage with those tangled vines and that spooky mine draft, and believe me, they look ready to dig some graves! üëÉüßµ

But don't count out the Bizarres just yet! Melesa Zelten is leading a synchronized chant that‚Äôs louder than a banshee in a library! These circus-folk have been practicing their aggressive theatrical poses, and Pompei Hephzipa looks like he‚Äôs ready to win a beauty pageant or break a jaw‚Äîpossibly both! It‚Äôs a shame my Ebon Gate Corruptors aren't the ones out here cracking skulls, but watching these two go at it is the next best thing. At least it's not the Haven Lights‚Äîthose blinding do-gooders make my skin crawl! üé≠üí•

With the bar open and the spirits flowing faster than the Starlight Lagoon, the fans are in for a treat! Even if the popularity polls favor the Stronghammers by a hair, the playoff atmosphere is anyone's game. Whether it‚Äôs the humming earth or the whiskey talking, I expect a total bloodbath! So, sit back, relax, and keep your eyes on the Trollball‚Äîit's time for some post-season carnage! üçªüèà
postGame:
Holy smokes, what a peach of a game! If you like your sports with a side of total physical annihilation, then you were in the right place! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres have taken Game 1 with a commanding 6 to 3 victory, leaving the Wyrmwood Stronghammers wondering if the earth was humming or if that was just their ears ringing from all the tackles! It was a real seesaw of a battle early on, with interceptions flying like bats out of a cave! Cornela Piscatelli and Demp Chet were trading possession like they were swapping gossip at a garden party! üì¢üò±

The first half was a total butcher shop, folks! We saw Cornela Piscatelli get absolutely flattened by Pompei Hephzipa, and before you could say 'medical malpractice,' Godart Urissa was returning the favor by injuring Demp Chet! The healers, Essa Pattie and Hamburger Marthe, were working harder than a one-armed wallpaper hanger! By the time halftime rolled around, the field was littered with more bodies than a poorly managed necropolis. But that‚Äôs the beauty of the Everwar‚Äîeveryone gets back up for more! üè•üíÄ

When the second half kicked off, the Bizarres decided they were done playing nice! Bush Heiner showed us all how it's done, lining up a shot from the 2-point zone and nailing it right into the basket! It was a display of precision that would make even Sir Tanos blush, though he‚Äôd probably try to stab the ball instead of passing it. The Bizarres really found their rhythm, despite the unstable footing and the tangled vines trying to trip 'em up at every turn! üéØüî•

Not to be outdone, Calvinna Isador showed some of that Stronghammer grit! She fired back with a 2-point shot of her own from center field, proving that you don't need to be literate to count to two! The crowd was going wild, or maybe they were just drunk on Imra‚Äôs special elixirs‚Äîeither way, the noise was deafening! It‚Äôs just a shame Count Trez Arrigo wasn't here to see his boys struggle; he probably would have tried to tax the Trollball mid-flight! üí∞ü§†

The brutality reached a fever pitch midway through the second half. We had a moment where one team had so few players left standing that the game almost turned into a solo act! Kerwin Gasper was handing out injuries like they were free samples at a bakery, taking Pompei Hephzipa right out of the play. But the Bizarres kept their cool, with Quintessa Austine sinking another long-range shot to keep the lead growing! ü•ñü§ï

I have to say, seeing Gagliano Tallbott and Sabian Gleason trading heavy hits was a highlight for the ages! Gagliano was out there telling jokes to the ball one minute and cracking ribs the next! Even with the Stronghammers‚Äô home-field advantage, they couldn't seem to stop the bleeding. The vines were thick, but the Bizarres‚Äô resolve was thicker! It was enough to make you forget about the 'heroes' of the realm for a moment‚Äîwho needs a God-King when you have a Halberd? üõ°Ô∏è‚ö°

Calvinna Isador tried to spark a comeback with a magnificent dunk right into the end zone, showing off some real athletic prowess! But for every step the Stronghammers took, the Bizarres took two. It was a classic case of too little, too late. The Stronghammers might have the backing of the Grove, but even High Priestess Oona couldn't pray away the beating they were taking on the scoreboard! üèÄüôè

The final nail in the coffin came from Melesa Zelten, who hammered home another 2-pointer from center field! At that point, the Stronghammers were looking more like 'Weak-mallets.' The Bizarres' strategy of synchronized chanting and theatrical posing seemed to have paid off, or maybe the Stronghammers just spent too much time braiding each other's hair and not enough time blocking! ü§°üî®

With a final score of 6 to 3, the Bizarres take a 1-0 lead in this Best-of-3 series! The Stronghammers are now staring down the barrel of the loser's bracket if they can't pull a rabbit out of their floppy hats in Game 2. It was a magnificent display of Trollball at its finest‚Äîviolent, chaotic, and completely unpredictable! Just how I like it! üèÜüéÜ

So, as the sun sets over Osterra and the players head to the infirmary (or the bar), remember: in Trollball, it‚Äôs not whether you win or lose, it‚Äôs how many people you take down with you! The Bizarres win Game 1! We'll see you next time for more playoff madness! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off and heading to the lounge to see if I can find some of that bacon grease Sondra uses on her boots! Goodnight, you beautiful monsters! üéôÔ∏èüñ§
